intro: Tetrapterys anomala, commonly known as the Indian nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a rough texture. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on slender pedicels. Tetrapterys anomala is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
